content: how to crochet a fun easy ripple crochet pattern perfect for running errands or a night out on the town or if you re like me holding your crochet supplies my remi series features fun ripple patterns worked mainly in double_crochet stitches there are some other stitches that help form the shape for the ripple pattern there is also a video tutorial 1 included **materials ** - about 195 yards of worsted weight cotton - i used wecrochet dishie 45 yards of mushroom 70 yards of verdigris and 80 yards of white - h8/5mm crochet hook - tapestry needle for weaving - optional jewelry pliers - optional fabric for lining & zipper i used a pre-made bag that i got at hobby lobby and stuck inside and then sewed in place - it measured 10 88 wide by 9 25 tall - optional sewing needle & thread or sewing machine & thread for lining **material notes ** yarn alternatives lion brand re-up lily sugar n cream with g6/4 25mm hook because it s a touch thicker other recommended yarns with i9/5 5mm hook because it s not as relaxed as cotton red heart super saver bernat super value caron one pound weaving in ends of a tough yarn like cotton yarn can be hard on the fingers sore thumbs and frustration can be a thing of the past by simply using jewelry pliers to carefully help pull the tapestry needle through the work **time spent ** i had my clutch ready in about two hours **gauge round 5 in pattern ** 14 half_double_crochet = 3 75 wide by 2 13 or 2 1/8 tall **abbreviations us terms ** - single_crochet - single_crochet - half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet - double_crochet - double_crochet - tc - triple crochet - dc3tog - double_crochet three stitches together decrease - explained in pattern *about your instant digital download purchase this is a 3 page pdf containing written instructions and 2 photos -
